C27Na39E8pSa0NPXfXDLIg.text: Favorite salad place in Singapore!!You can build your own salad, and the toppings/choices are amazing. My favorite toppings are the soba noodles, eggplant, beets and mushroom! They sell acai and smoothie bowls too, looks like a good range of options.

3lbobNub2PbblQ_XiGMm0Q.text: I didn't think much of this place when I had my salad with soup and sandwich shortly after it opened. I thought it was a wannabe following the success of Saladstop several years ago when there were just not many salad places. Fast forward to this week. I wanted some fresh veggies and this was the only option then. I am glad I gave it another try. The menu has been tweaked and there are more varieties in what's available. Plus I found the yummy toppings which i like - mushrooms and beets. Besides the regular salad with the cold deli or protein, you can also order hot protein for your salad. It may look confusing but it is quite easy to choose what you want. You can also add the soup and sandwich to your salad. As this is part of Cedele, you can be sure the soup will be good, likewise for the bread.

photos.caption: Photo of Toss & Turn - Singapore, Singapore. Regular salad
Photo of Toss & Turn - Singapore, Singapore. Small soup - beef stew
Photo of Toss & Turn - Singapore, Singapore. The mushrooms and beets are the best part.

yoUua7WV_UJblyNjpnyFEg.text: This s an awesome salad chain in the heart of Orchard. For $12, you get a mixed of romaine lettuce and pasta/rice, choose 2 proteins and 4 greens and either an iced tea or orange juice.The pasta and rice selection are delicious, always a plus for someone who tries to eat healthy yet still want some carbs choices.The proteins are great. There are the heavily marinated mushrooms, the cheese, smoked salmon, sausages, chicken and tuna to choose from. The greens are not too shabby, I would say. However, I have quite a tough time to choose them because I personally don't eat quite a few greens, thus leaving me with options like edamame, braised brinjals, red beans, olives, nuts, eggs.  There are  also broccoli, corns, beetroots, sprouts, cherry tomatoes, etc. For $13, you can have a bowl of salad and a soup. It is a good deal, only in Singapore.

s3_WC2rdoZuhq_S1fqiDpA.text: Salads are fresh and delicious, prices are affordable,  and I really love their sandwiches despite them being small. Aside from their very average soups, there's nothing lacking. Full marks! 5 stars given for:+ price + taste+ service+ ambience/cleanliness + revisitability

photos.caption: Photo of Toss & Turn - Singapore, Singapore

KsUqcRfiriIGM1KsNmXbPg.text: Ok I have always loved eating here coz they used to serve big portions and u can request for two salad dressings ....but recently what happened to the salad portions? To be fair, They do try to help customers by maintaining the price but visibly reduced veggies and even prawns are down to 3 as one staff explained politely, " management directives..." Ok... Depending on staff , some are friendly and accommodating but others are....meh... Not very consistent.

photos.caption: Photo of Toss & Turn - Singapore, Singapore. Big salad serving & many choices of veggies & proteins. comes w small bowl of soup for extra S$2.50.gd choices of soups

ckEJX3n8rdxCUSg-Qlgevw.text: My favourite place to grab something delicious and healthy in Singapore! It's fast, its affordable, and you can load up on loads of veggies - the portions are huge! The one thing that I've always felt was missing from Singapore was a good ol' salad bar and low and behold - one has now been presented to us!I actually come here on the way to work or whatever just to get a salad. Sometimes I'll drive down with the family to grab salads and then go home again if theres no food in the house (and we're all being a bunch of lazy people .. but really just for the fact that their salads taste a lot better than what we would make haha).Would definitely recommend toss & turn if you're in the orchard area. There are now quite a few 'salad bars' but this is definitely my favourite with taste, options, flavour and portion size. It's a winner!

photos.caption: Photo of Toss & Turn - Singapore, Singapore

ZIry6wksqwkDgj5AkyTCyA.text: Toss & Turn by Cedele should be a fairly new concept, so new that even their service staff had trouble articulating the various sets that we tried ordering!Dont get me wrong, the food is pretty good and the concept of sandwiches, soups and salads is great. Plus the fact that it's be Cedele, you can be sure that quality of the food is awesome as well and it's really great!However, the number of sets are somewhat too many, it confused not just the consumers but also the service staff. A mix of small/half sandwiches plus large/full size soup vs the other way round and not forgetting throwing salad into the whole combo, it's not easy to grasp that quickly.Because of that, the order process became a struggle. As everyone queued along the "canteen" line, the wait took a little long as most customers had to clarify the sets and details of the order with the service staff. Perhaps giving it a little more time, things will get more familiar.

photos.caption: Photo of Toss & Turn - Singapore, Singapore. Large spicy tomato soup, mushroom melt sandwich and a small DIY salad

_LKJZ3Nbq0LwnBbz6GN4Vw.text: Rude cashier man will make you lose your appetite. Decent food, by Singapore standards.

Gw967UIKdVDcpdwZ4bHq4g.text: We came here on a Friday night and they were out of almost all their toppings for the custom salad. In exchange, they let us pick another protein, but could only have 1 topping (instead of 2 protein and 4 toppings). Well, not that I really minded, but seriously, shouldnt they have stocked up their ingredients in preparation for the weekend crowd? Mind boggling.Anyhow, serving portion here, especially for the salad, is VERY generous. I shared a full sized salad with my girlfriend before gym, and we were both decently filled. They have a half portion salad too, but for more than half the price. Not sure how the Math works. But hey, I'd recommend just taking away the remaining of your salad if you can't finish it. Makes another meal :)

nAMWmdEKIFrwAajfchLmbA.text: I really wanted a salad for dinner and was thankful that this is close by to work. A regular salad for $9 and you get 1 salad base, 2 deli/protein and 2 veggie/crunchies. I was delighted to see them offer smoked salmon (generous rolls) and shrimp so i chose those but my other favorite beetroot was in the same category so i couldn't have that - bummer. Choices in general were not that many and the self serve salad dressings were not that exciting in variety too( i think it was just 5). in short, I'm just spoiled by what Salad Stop offers at almost the same price. Unless I'm craving for smoked salmon or shrimp, i don't believe I'll be at Toss & Turn much. I must however mention there is deal going on now and it's a full sandwich with either a small side of soup or salad for $12.90; the shrimp avocado with spicy sauce sandwich actually looks quite yummy.

gizNr74PWCzVD2dWwng5IA.text: Love the huge portion. A mountain of healthy ingredients for $9.90! You can choose a salad base (vege/cous cous), 2 proteins and 2 others. Their salmon and edemame are safe choices! Sometimes the vege is abit tough to bite. Oh By Friday night, they run out of a lot of ingredients... :/ Pretty hard to get a seat as well since it's such a small store.

photos.caption: Photo of Toss & Turn - Singapore, Singapore. Love the huge portion. Just for $9.90

BLUXE-Pxj_l4TAcYr1oTIA.text: What a steal!The portion is huge and the food itself is very delicious. They also made ordering quite a breeze with very clear pricing and instructions. Base (greens/pasta/couscous) + 2 proteins (salmon/shrimps/mushrooms) + 4 toppings (beans,etc.). This is a complete different experience from Saladstop - limited free toppings and the proteins are always too pricey. I do hope Cedele opens more of this salad bar.

HlvbZ_I55j2VjjQu1q-Quw.text: I'm sorry to say that my last two times here have been disappointing. Now they are rationing out protein at half of what they originally offered, which has turned this from a good deal into a ripoff. They also were not generous with any portion of anything, the only constant was the boiled egg. I'm not coming back.

NbqhuR9eXf5VsVEWK2wTcg.text: My to-go-place for a quick lunch/dinner.$9 for a huge salad/cous-cous/rice/pasta base (you could to half-leaves-half-couscous which I always do), two protein choice (e.g. egg frittata/ roast chicken / peppered prawns) and two veg/beans choices (e.g. raisins / carrots / edamame / corn). You could add any amount of seeds/nuts to your salad from the dressing/nuts counter. I would normally have half of the regular salad for lunch/dinner and keep the other half for my next meal.I always feel that $9 is a steal. Long lines always during dining hours. But the waitstaff are really efficient and so the lines move quickly. I really really hope that Cedele will open up a few more Toss & Turn eateries around the island. The other salad places are way too over-priced.

5oX27lnbNyBuQoOZmfpmHA.text: I have lived in Singapore approximately three weeks and have already eaten here three times! I love it! As a very health conscious eater and an American who has yet to learn the ins and outs of more local fair, this is my "safe go to" when I am out and about. I always get the same thing: mixed salad with chicken breast and walnuts, edamame, red beans, broccoli and red bell pepper with plum sesame dressing. I feel like the portion is really generous. Ingredients are fresh and tasty. It slightly reminds me of a spot in the US, Salata. However, Salata allows unlimited toppings of fruits and veggies. Oh the glory! Nothing will ever be that great, but this is a fine substitute while I am residing in Singapore.

dn5-u3ksFSiJRM-zRAz7Pg.text: Must say I was a little disappointed considering how much I like cedele. Food was so-so. Service was terrible. Wife waited 40mins for her sandwich. Reminded them once and was told it was coming. Finally found out they totally forgot her order. Staff all appear very junior so I guess some leeway should be given but I honestly expected more from the food. Had the beef pastrami and ham cous cous but came across as a little bland and jelak. The prawn avocado chees and spicy jam sandwich was just weird. Don't think I'll be back here.

photos.caption: Photo of Toss & Turn - Singapore, Singapore. Prawn Avocado Cheese & Spicy Jam Sandwich
Photo of Toss & Turn - Singapore, Singapore. Beef Pastrami and Ham Cous Cous

0JtwTn1VmBD9aKYx-19pxw.text: Best value place to grab a healthy lunch. HUGE portion of healthy goodness for 9 bucks! Makes me feel salad stop has been ripping me off lol The only con is it gets real busy around lunch time, the queue can be really long and finding a place to sit is quite a challenge

reX1A6RU4v4VhRJ8WYXr4A.text: Good salads... food appears to be fresh...  tasty salads and interesting dressings...
